content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <feed xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <title>University of California, Irvine History</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10575/5882" rel="alternate"/> <subtitle/> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10575/5882</id> <updated>2015-03-12T04:33:30Z</updated> <dc:date>2015-03-12T04:33:30Z</dc:date> <entry> <title>Birth of a Campus (University of California, Irvine)</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11418" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11418</id> <updated>2015-03-11T11:01:25Z</updated> <published>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Birth of a Campus (University of California, Irvine) An episode of the documentary television program, Survey '65. Documents the dedication of the University of California, Irvine campus site on June 20, 1964. Includes a brief history of the Irvine Ranch and the Irvine Company, and statements of purpose by architect William L. Pereira and Chancellor Daniel G. Aldrich. President Lyndon B. Johnson is shown in attendance at the dedication. </summary> <dc:date>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Birth of a Campus</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11420" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11420</id> <updated>2015-03-11T11:01:25Z</updated> <published>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Birth of a Campus Footage from an episode of the documentary television program, Survey '65. Clips include footage used in "Birth of a Campus", which documents the dedication of the University of California, Irvine campus site on June 20, 1964. </summary> <dc:date>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Interview with Schuyler Hadley Bassett</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11421" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10575/11421</id> <updated>2015-03-11T11:02:18Z</updated> <published>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Interview with Schuyler Hadley Bassett Interview with Schuyler Hadley Bassett in 2009. Bassett was part of UCI\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds first freshman class when the school\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds doors first opened in 1965.  Although he did not come up with the initial idea of the anteater mascot, he spearheaded the successful campaign that decided on the anteater. In this interview he reminisces and retells the story forty-four years after the mascot election, which occurred in November of 1965. </summary> <dc:date>2014-06-18T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> <entry> <title>Interview with Robert Cohen</title> <link href="http://hdl.handle.net/10575/5963" rel="alternate"/> <author> <name/> </author> <id>http://hdl.handle.net/10575/5963</id> <updated>2015-03-11T11:00:37Z</updated> <published>2013-02-11T00:00:00Z</published> <summary type="text">Interview with Robert Cohen Founding Chair of UCI Drama Department, Claire Trevor Professor of Drama </summary> <dc:date>2013-02-11T00:00:00Z</dc:date> </entry> </feed>
